definition: dictionary/encyclopedia
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write
lexicography

sentences.english: His poems and articles have been adopted by many anthologies and dictionaries in China.
sentences.chinese: 诗文成果名录被多种选集和辞书登载。

sentences.english: He is looking for his dictionary, but he can't find it.
sentences.chinese: 他正在找他的辞书，可是找不到。

sentences.english: Research on the synonyms of the ancient Chinese in the Special book helps to revise the large-scale Chinese lexicographical work.
sentences.chinese: 古汉语专书同义词研究有助于大型语文辞书的修订。

sentences.english: A dictionary is an invaluable aid in learning a new language .
sentences.chinese: 在学习一种新言语时，辞书黑白常有效的东西。

sentences.english: I would like him to buy a dictionary for me.
sentences.chinese: 我想要他帮我去买辞书。

sentences.english: This paper can be regard as a useful reference for revising Grand Chinese Dictionary and compiling other Chinese dictionaries.
sentences.chinese: 可供《大字典》修订和汉语语文辞书编纂时参考。

sentences.english: Many dated expressions are being dropped from the new dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 这本新辞书中增走了很多过期的词语。

sentences.english: The organic combination of these different ways forms lexicon language style.
sentences.chinese: 而这些方式的有机组合，便构成了辞书语体。

sentences.english: A bit of lexicographical trivia for you there.
sentences.chinese: 一个对你有位辞书琐事。

sentences.english: The Chinese encyclopaedia bears a distinctive stylistic feature which is characteristic of Chinese encyclopaedias.
sentences.chinese: 中文百科全书具有独特的“辞书语言”语体特征。

sentences.english: Dictionary writers must be skilled in ther art of definition.
sentences.chinese: 辞书编纂者必须精于给词语下定义的技巧。

definition: Cihai, an encyclopedic dictionary first published in 1915, and frequently revised
dictionary/also written 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3]/CL:本[ben3],部[bu4]
reference book (such as dictionary, almanac, gazetteer etc)
dictionary/also written 辭典|辞典[ci2 dian3]/CL:部[bu4],本[ben3]
the Kangxi Dictionary, named after the Kangxi Emperor, who in 1710 ordered its compilation, containing 47,035 single-character entries
Hanyu Da Cidian, the largest Chinese dictionary, with over 375,000 word entries, first published 1986-1994
to write/literary work/book/article/writings/CL:部[bu4]
writing/to write/to compile
Hanyu Da Zidian, one of the most comprehensive Chinese character dictionaries with 54,678 (and later 60,370) entries, first published between 1986-1990
to compile
monograph/specialized text
to publish
a series of books/a collection of books
collected works
treatise/study
to collect words/to harvest entries for a dictionary
